title: Ask HN: Is Anybody Using Stage Manager on macOS Ventura?
text:
I installed Ventura and tried using Stage Manager, but I don’t get what problem it’s solving.

Apple states, “Stage Manager automatically organizes open apps and windows so users can concentrate on their work and still see everything in a single glance.“

The problem is I can’t actually “see everything in a single glance” because the app thumbnails are too small.

Additionally, the feature seems to be redundant to Expose and the Dock.

Am I missing something? Is anybody using Stage Manager and finding it helpful? If so please share.

Ask HN: What is the best way to meet with potential startup co-founders
text: I am looking to preferably meet serious technical cofounders who are working on existing startups or people looking to collaborate together on a new idea. I have tried YC co-founder match and meetup networking events but most of the people are non-responsive or not committed and I prefer to meet IRL. Recently moved to the bay area and looking for suggestions. Thanks!

Some Games I've been Working On
text:
DATABASE ==

The ultimate programming game. Solve challenges or just start from a base and make your own levels.

Challenge 0: Boys Suck (Development)

Challenge 1: Girls Rule (Development)

These challenges start with broken systems. In the Boy's version, you can't even login due to an error in an initialisation file. In the Girl's version, the disk is full. Fix the system, somehow, and you can have all the data and tools that are on the system.

Challenge 2: Borked Haiku (base)

Pulling DATABASE with Git from 192.168.0.42 doesn't work and causes the system to crash. Still works but use at your own risk.

Challenge 3: DATABASE for Adults (Security)

There's a folder called private/ and the contents are NSFW. You don't have sudo or su. Can you see what's in it?

Challenge 4: Golem Node (Sharing)

Golem is a distributed supercomputer, but doesn't work in some VM's. Make it work and join the swarm.

Also available as:

DATABASE for Girls (base)

DATABASE for Boys (base)

These are for creating your own levels. Keep going until you break it. Package it up with a story of how you broke it and publish.

The ultimate games. Infinite in extent and perfect for training. Once you crack the code to get in, you have a wealth of data and tools to play with. Source included in Girls and Adult versions.

Ask HN: Purposely-inefficient daily tasks to keep in shape?
text:
Wondering what others do in terms of daily tasks to help stay in shape.

It has to be something outside of a pure exercise activity, such as going for a walk or bike ride.

An example is to purposely park far away from a shop entrance so as to get a little extra walking in.

I'm particularly interested in strength-related ideas.

Ask HN: What is the most unethical thing you've done as a programmer?
text: There was an article recently about cell service providers selling extremely granular location data, and some of the programmers working on those systems immediately showed up on HN to comment on their moral dilemma. I suspect it's not an isolated case.

Ask HN: Where does your pricing scheme come from?
text: Are you researching and trying to beat the competition or match the competition? Are you going with a price that makes sense for you and pricing your products and services based on your mortgage, how you feel, or the amount of work and time you put into developing your web app? Are you asking others about whether your pricing makes sense? More importantly, is your first listed pricing working for you or do you find yourself having to adjust it to a lower or higher price after your release and acquiring multiple users?
